meanings.definition: Move unsteadily from side to side.
meanings.sent1: The toddler was wobbling as he took his first steps.
meanings.sent2: The table was wobbling because one of its legs was shorter than the others.
meanings.sent3: The penguin looked funny wobbling on the ice.
meanings.sent4: Her confidence was wobbling like a Jenga tower on the verge of collapse.
meanings.sent5: The old bridge was wobbling dangerously in the wind.

meanings.sent1: The leaf was wobbling in the breeze.
meanings.sent2: His voice wobbled with fear as he spoke to the large crowd.
meanings.sent3: The jello on the plate was wobbling like a bowl of jelly.
meanings.sent4: Her heart wobbled with excitement at the thought of the upcoming trip.
meanings.sent5: The candle flame was wobbling in the drafty room.

meanings.sent1: She was wobbling between choosing the red or blue dress.
meanings.sent2: The politician was wobbling on his stance regarding the new policy.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was wobbling on whether to climb the tree or stay on the ground.
meanings.sent4: His loyalty wobbled between his two best friends.
meanings.sent5: The student's grades were wobbling due to his lack of focus.
